text: syriza holds a hundred and forty-nine
out of 300 seats in the Greek parliament
it gains its majority through a
coalition with the right wing
independent Greeks party which has 13
seats one problem we'll be keeping the
hardline part of syriza on side
seventeen members of syriza left
platform refused to support the
leadership last time and there could be
more now one solution would be to rely
on the support of the moderate
opposition the centrist toppa Tommy has
said it will definitely back the
government and a larger New Democracy
party may do also ultimately though
Alexis tsipras will need something more
solid perhaps a national unity
government to hold things together and
with his own party split it could mean
new leadership or even new elections
